snippet: The villa is at the center of the criminal charges against Bo Xilai, a fallen Communist Party aristocrat, that include accusations of taking bribes from a young Chinese billionaire.
abstract: Villa in Cannes, France, is at center of criminal charges against Bo Xilai, fallen Communist Party aristocrat, who has been accused of taking bribes worth more than $3.5 million from young Chinese billionaire Xu Ming; Chinese authorities allege villa was bought by Xu and given to Bo family.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG, JONATHAN ANSFIELD and SCOTT SAYARE
byline.contributor: Edward Wong and Jonathan Ansfield reported from Beijing, and Scott Sayare from Paris. Bernadette Murphy contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The villa is at the center of the criminal charges against Bo Xilai, a fallen Communist Party aristocrat, that include accusations of taking bribes from a young Chinese billionaire.

headline.main: Cannes Villa Is Expected to Play Role in Bribery Case Against Chinese Ex-Official
headline.print_headline: Cannes Villa Is Expected to Play Role in Bribery Case Against Chinese Ex-Official

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations
